newsitem.title: GERMANY: Tietmeyer-Buba, Bonn oppose softening of EMU goals.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer-Buba, Bonn oppose softening of EMU goals.

text.p: Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer said on Thursday that the Bundesbank maintained there must be no softening of the Maastricht criteria for monetary union.
"The Treaty is the Treaty and in the Treaty there are dates. If the dates are not adhered to then this is an issue for politicians."
Tietmeyer also said the Bundesbank was doing all it could to ensure that the deadlines for monetary union can be met.
He said that any discussions about currency union must not "lead to a softening of the criteria."
Tietmeyer was speaking at a news conference following a regular policy-setting council meeting.
Tietmeyer also said the next convergence report for the European Monetary Institute (EMI) would clarify the definition of the convergence criteria.
